channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Danielle Cronin
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should contact (not visit) your GP, local hospital or 13HEALTH.
item.title: Coronavirus LIVE Queensland updates: about 100,000 COVID-19 tests performed as state warned not to cause a second wave of infections

item.dc:creator: Marissa Calligeros
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus LIVE updates: Victorian schools could reopen this term; Treasury warns of permanent job losses; nation's death toll stands at 84

item.dc:creator: Sarah Keoghan
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Australians download COVIDSafe app more than 2 million times, social distancing in NSW partially relaxed, nation's death toll stands at 85

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: Just as cooped-up Queenslanders are ready to emerge from weeks of social distancing, temperatures are expected to plummet below zero in parts of the state.Â
item.title: Winter comes early with mercury to plunge to single digits in Brisbane

item.dc:creator: Fran Rimrod
item.description: A Perth clinical research company has been selected to undertake a human trial of a vaccine to combat COVID-19.
item.title: WA coronavirus LIVE: Perth research company seeks West Australians for COVID-19 vaccine trial

item.dc:creator: Jamila Rizvi
item.description: How late is too late to a Zoom meeting? And how do you maintain polite chit-chat with the neighbour showing flagrant disregard for the six-feet rule?
item.title: Ending a video call in a pandemic and other etiquette questions

item.description: West Coast are taking advantage of relaxed coronavirus restrictions in Western Australia to resume training in larger groups.
item.title: Eagles, Dockers to get a jump on their rivals

item.description: North Melbourne's Shaun Atley has had no shortage of fierce training partners while in lockdown.
item.title: Atley brothers bond in AFL season shutdown

item.description: Coronavirus assessment centres have been established across Queensland.
item.title: Where to get tested for coronavirus in Queensland

item.description: In other places, such as Colombia, Ghana, and Iraq young people are joining humanitarian workers in delivering supplies to front-line health workers.
item.title: With more youth online, extremists step up recruiting, says UN chief

item.dc:creator: Heather McNeill
item.description: The fibres were recovered from Mr Edwards' rape victim, and the bodies of Jane Rimmer and Sarah Spiers.
item.title: Claremont killer trial LIVE: Defence reveals common fibres found on victims that state deemed irrelevant

item.description: An Indian man has pleaded guilty to knifing his wife 22 times after she told him she wanted a divorce.
item.title: Man admits stabbing wife 22 times in Brisbane home

item.description: Coronavirus outbreaks among staff and inspectors are forcing the closure of some of the country's and overseas suppliers' biggest slaughterhouses.
item.title: With the food chain breaking down, US is on cusp of meat shortage

item.dc:creator: Barney Zwartz
item.description: Tram driver Mark Papworth, also an accomplished musician, has adapted Wagner's Ring for horn, tuba and piano.
item.title: Wagner reinterpreted, bold as brass, by tram driver

item.dc:creator: Sam Phillips
item.description: The NSW Origin halfback is the subject of an NRL and police investigation after photos emerged of him getting close to a group of female friends on ANZAC Day.
item.title: Panthers star Cleary caught flouting social distancing protocol

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: Three men had been inside the Alexandra Hills home last week when police say one, aged 24, was shot in the stomach.
item.title: Armed robbery, driving charges for second man in alleged shooting

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: Treasurer Jackie Trad has not ruled out increasing Queensland's debt bill to save the state from economic ruin.Â
item.title: 'Queensland had weak economy before virus': Debt to blow out

item.description: An exercise physiologist can help turn someone's life around â and sometimes even save it.
item.title: Giving the gift of positive exercise

item.dc:creator: Benjamin Preiss
item.description: Schools are expected to remain closed for the rest of term two, even though there were just two new confirmed coronavirus cases overnight.
item.title: 'We can't flick a switch', says Andrews as he stands firm on schools

item.dc:creator: Stephen A Russell
item.description: Solo artist and DJ Allysha Joy is performing on Wednesday night for Monash University's online concert series.
item.title: Joy to the people: Keep dancing through the lockdown

item.description: Any efforts at reducing inmates' contact were blown away in El Salvador when authorities crammed prisoners together in prison yards while searching their cells.
item.title: Coronavirus spreads fear through Latin America's crowded prisons

item.dc:creator: Sally Rawsthorne
item.description: Homicide detectives are appealing for the public's help as they investigate the mysterious fatal bashing of a man in western Sydney.
item.title: 'Unclear' motive for fatal bashing of man in unit stairwell

item.dc:creator: Karl Quinn
item.description: The world's biggest film festivals, many cancelled because of the coronavirus, have united to host a 10-day programme on YouTube.
item.title: Sydney joins Cannes, Berlin, Sundance for virtual film festival

item.description: Vaccine optimism from UK as more than 2 million Australians download COVIDSafe app.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: Queensland authorities are urging everyone to get their flu shots as soon as possible, but many GPs are still struggling to get stock of the general vaccine.
item.title: Queensland GPs struggle to get flu shots as flu season begins

item.dc:creator: Roy Masters
item.description: In his dreams, a seriously ill Sydney man, Ross Campbell, has a round of golf regularly with the 2013 Masters champion Adam Scott. So Mr Campbell was delighted to find Scott on the other end of the phone.
item.title: No cameras, no trophies, but Adam Scott just won the lockdown's act of kindness award

item.dc:creator: Clancy Yeates
item.description: Westpac's first-half profit will take a $2.2 billion hit from charges for soured loans, including a $1.6 billion impairment caused by the coronavirus pandemic.
item.title: Westpac flags $2.2b hit from soured loans

item.description: As students in other states go back to the classroom this week and others prepare for phased returns, we asked Victorian parents how they feel about the prospect of keeping children at home until the end of term two.
item.title: Should we return to school? Here's what readers are telling us

item.dc:creator: Stephen Bartholomeusz
item.description: Wall Street is technically back in a bull marketÂ and Donald Trump is foreshadowing a dramatic recovery in the US economy - what could go wrong?
item.title: Trump's 'spectacular' recovery is about to bump up against cold hard facts

item.dc:creator: James Massola
item.description: Government officials claim coronavirus infections have been on a downward trend in the past week.
item.title: Indonesia wants to go back to normal in July but questions linger

item.dc:creator: Jason Steger
item.description: The Australian writer says she has learnt how to deal with the criticism her work can attract.
item.title: Helen Garner to be honoured as a pioneer by the book industry

item.dc:creator: Michael Lynch
item.description: Jockey Ben Melham faces a minimum mandatory two-year ban after allegations of betting. But he is allowed to continue riding until the case is heard.
item.title: Melham charge carries mandatory two-year minimum ban

item.dc:creator: Simon Johanson
item.description: Lendlease is moving to shore up its balance sheet and protect its development pipeline from the ravages of the coronavirus pandemic.
item.title: Diversified developer Lendlease taps investors for $1.15b

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: Brisbane Times can reveal how many airconditionersÂ have been installed at the 301 Queensland target schools named in November.
item.title: How many classrooms have been airconditioned during the pandemic

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: The amount of face-to-face contact between students and teachers will depend on the state's ability to keep the coronavirus at bay, Queensland's Premier says.
item.title: 'Everything is on the table': Queensland schools to reopen in some way in May

item.description: In 1965, the Australian Government committed 1000 front-line troops to the war in Vietnam after a request for military assistance from the South Vietnamese Government.
item.title: From the Archives, 1965: Australia commits front-line troops to Vietnam

item.description: The 840 AFL players will be invited to hook up via a nationwide teleconference on Tuesday before submitting their thoughts on key issues via an email survey.
item.title: AFL players to thrash out footy restart issues

item.description: The former first lady's memoir has sold more than 10 million copies.
item.title: Michelle Obama's Becoming documentary to hit Netflix

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: The three-week-old baby girl remains in hospital, more than a month after the incident came to the attention of police.
item.title: Baby left with 'life-threatening injuries' after Sunshine Coast assault

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: Premier Gladys Berejiklian says the timeline for the return to full-time schooling will be revised after a fortnight of having students in school on a rostered basis.
item.title: NSW wants children back at school full time before end of term 2

item.description: Some of his best work

item.description: The latest work by Sydney Morning Herald editorial cartoonist Cathy Wilcox.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Cathy Wilcox

item.dc:creator: Lucy Battersby
item.description: The S&P/ASX 200 has given up morning gains, dragged down by healthcare and materials sector stocks. US futures are pointing to declines.
item.title: ASX softens as financials, materials, and healthcare drag

item.description: Andrew Weldon has been a contributor to The Age and The Sunday Age for many years. His cartoons have been published widely nationally and internationally, including in The New Yorker, The Spectator and Private Eye. He has published two book collections of his work and several childrens' books. He smells funny.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Andrew Weldon

item.description: Mark Evans says the elite training, playing and broadcast facilities on the Gold Coast and in Brisbane help make Queensland an ideal host of an AFL quarantine hub.
item.title: Queensland has compelling case to be AFL hub: Suns CEO

item.description: Illustrations by the artist from The Age.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Matt Golding

item.description: Senior football figures Chris Scott and Neil Balme have cautioned against dramatic cuts to the AFL in the wake of the coronavirus-enforced shutdown of the competition.
item.title: Scott, Balme urge against further AFL cuts

item.description: "We may have to think in terms of some different ways to put money in people's pockets," said the House Speaker.
item.title: Nancy Pelosi says 'guaranteed income' plan for Americans worth considering

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, April 28, 2020

item.dc:creator: Dominic Powell
item.description: Retailing conglomerate Wesfarmers will fast track a review of struggling department store Target, opening the door for a possible sale or restructure.
item.title: Wesfarmers flags store closures for Target as part of major restructure
